column1: Online TransactionPay Online   Link to External Website
• e-commerce
On-line payments can now be made for Council Tax, Business rates, Mortgages, Car Park fines or general debts
• e-forms
An index of on-line forms available for either downloading, printing or electronic submission
The Council has a strategy and an action plan for using the Internet to improve access to its services
a borough-wide ICT partnership of public, private and voluntary organisations
an annual award ceremony celebrating local excellence in ICT
• Early Years - Surestart Tameside
the Government's programme to deliver the best start in life for every child by bringing together: early education, childcare, health and family support.
• Ear Piercing Licences
for information and to register premises and operatives
• ECDL - European Computer Driving Licence

ECDL is an internationally recognised qualification that enables people to develop and demonstrate their competence in computer skills. Tameside currently has three ECDL test centres at: Learn@StAnn's, Ashton-under-Lyne, and Hattersley Computer Centre, Hattersley
Advising on wildlife and nature conservation
the Unit plays a key role in achieving one of the Council's foremost strategic aims, encouraging inward investment into the Borough
The indicators chosen give a good overall picture of the local economy, whilst also providing comparative information with the Greater Manchester conurbation and the North West region.
• Economic and Learning Partnership
A partnership body made up of public, private and voluntary organisations.
Help and advice for businesses in Tameside on EMU and the euro.
• Education
The council provides over 100 primary, secondary and special schools for local young people.
An allowance is to assist dependent pupils aged 16 to 19 to follow full-time courses at school.
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Egyptology Clubs within the Borough
• Elderly People
Links to a host of information for older people.
Provide residential care to elderly people who are unable to live at home.
for a list of homes, information leaflets and inspection reports.
For information about the Council Elections.
• Electoral Register
Your name must be on the electoral register if you wish to use your right to vote.
Safety advice from our Trading Standards Division
• Electricity (United Utilities)
For information and to register premises and operatives
A list of the most frequently requested email addresses within the Council
For any council services telephone our 24 hour emergency line - 0161 342 2222 or by minicom on 0161 342 3009
The Civil Contingencies Act 2004 places an obligation on Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council to prepare and plan for major incidents or emergencies that may occur within its borough
• Employment and Training Initiatives
Find out more about training in your local community and the venues in which these courses are held
The Council has an empty property strategy and aims to reduce the number of residential properties standing empty to a minimum
• Empty Properties - Council Tax
If you own an empty property you may be eligible for a Council Tax Discount.
Insulating your home may not be as expensive as you think

The council carry out programmed inspections of business premises, responding to complaints and offering advice. The enforcement policy outlines the approach the council take when considering enforcement action.
The Engineering Service has overall responsibility for a number of functions provided by the Council.
• Entertainment and Events in Tameside
For details of up and coming events in the area

The council is committed to improving the local environment and helping protect the global environment through Local Agenda 21, the global conference where national governments pledged to work towards protecting the environment
• Environment - Tameside Business Environment Association

Links to the home site of TBEA which is a non-profit partnership organisation aimed at helping Tameside companies take full advantage of the benefits associated with improved control of the environmental aspects of their activities
• Environment - Year of our Enviroment 2003
• Environmental Health
See also consumer advice, dog warden services, dustbins, food, health and safety, licensing, pest control, pollution, refuse collection, trading standards, 0161 342 8355
are carried out in the declared Renewal Areas in Ashton and Hyde
Links to a range of pollution related services covering air quality, noise, asbestos etc.
• Equipment for People with Disabilities
• Euro - Single European Currency
Help and advice for businesses in Tameside on the euro and the European Monetary Union (EMU).
A large proportion of resources from Europe are used to stimulate economic and social development following the decline of manufacturing in the area.
• European Members of Parliament
The United Kingdom has been a member of the EU since 1973 and is one of 27 countries that now work together within the Union.
• Events Calendar

To find out what's on in Tameside - includes events for the forthcoming months, regular sporting events, dances, clubs for kids and the elderly and lots more. Use our Organising your Event in Tameside Guide 507.69 KB which provides information and help when planning your event, regardless of the size. It contains useful contact lists, information, web addresses, checklists for planning your event and blank risk assessment forms for your use.

Tameside Arts and Events Team are responsible for organising an annual programme of public events throughout the Borough and for co-ordinating a range of community arts projects in Tameside's Regeneration areas
Summary Examination Results for all Tameside Schools.
To obtain past examination results and certificates visit www.ncer.org
For details of exhibitions held in local library galleries
Exhumations are generally rare. They cannot happen without having the necessary legal authorisation.
Links to partners and other external sites of interest
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
